title: [enhancement](load) multipass segcompaction to reduce segments before publish (#14590)
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #14590

## Problem summary

Do final-pass segcompaction before committing txn to reduce segment number. Will increase load time but eliminate OLAP_ERR_TOO_MANY_SEGMENTS failure. 

Test results
```
test config:
  4* 8c32g  4be&3fe
  5*7.5G tpch data
  Parallel = 2
  set   write_buffer_size=20971520 (20M) to simulate memory-shortage-memtble-flushing to get more segments.
```
|Segment Num      |      |
| ------------------------- | ---- |
| Original                  | 3869 |
| After 1st SegCompaction   | 396  |
| After final SegCompaction | 7    |

| Memory Consumption              |      |
| ------------------------------- | ---- |
| SegCompaction Memory usage Peak | 4GB  |

| Time Cost                          |        |
| ---------------------------------- | ------ |
| Total load time                    | 1h15m  |
| Publish wait final compaction time | 5.7min |



## Checklist(Required)

title: [enhancement](memory) Refactored process memory statistics periodically refresh, and fix catch bad_alloc
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

## Problem summary

This pr is to reduce the probability of OOM.

1. Previously, process memory statistics were refreshed every 1 second, including `/proc/meminfo`, `/proc/self/status`, `metrics of tcmalloc and jemalloc`, consumption of each type of `mem tracker`, this refresh frequency is very Slow, making it impossible to respond in time before OOM.
Now when the process is about to exceed the limit and the system memory available is insufficient, the refresh frequency will be accelerated, which will not affect performance.

2. Fixed thread catch bad_alloc, which will also help avoid OOM

## Checklist(Required)

1. Does it affect the original behavior:

```sql
-- create table
Create Table: CREATE TABLE `t1` (
```

title: [fix](parquet-reader) the value of null map will overflow when LazyRead merges too many empty batches
body:
# Proposed changes

## Problem summary
When running q18 of tpch100, some errors were thrown:
```
doris_be: /mnt/disk2/gaoxin/ws/doris/be/src/vec/common/pod_array.h:337: T& doris::vectorized::PODArray<T, initial_bytes, TAllocator, pad_right_, pad_left_>::operator[](ssize_t) [with T = unsigned char; long unsigned int initial_bytes = 4096; TAllocator = Allocator<false>; long unsigned int pad_right_ = 15; long unsigned int pad_left_ = 16; ssize_t = long int]: Assertion `(n >= (static_cast<ssize_t>(pad_left_) ? -1 : 0)) && (n <= static_cast<ssize_t>(this->size()))' failed.
7# doris::vectorized::ColumnSelectVector::set_run_length_null_map(std::vector<unsigned short, std::allocator<unsigned short> > const&, unsigned long, doris::vectorized::PODArray<unsigned char, 4096ul, Allocator<false, false>, 15ul, 16ul>*) at /mnt/disk2/gaoxin/ws/doris/be/src/vec/exec/format/parquet/parquet_common.cpp:118
8# doris::vectorized::ScalarColumnReader::_read_values(unsigned long, COW<doris::vectorized::IColumn>::immutable_ptr<doris::vectorized::IColumn>&, std::shared_ptr<doris::vectorized::IDataType const>&, doris::vectorized::ColumnSelectVector&) at /mnt/disk2/gaoxin/ws/doris/be/src/vec/exec/format/parquet/vparquet_column_reader.cpp:177
```

The run length of null map is saved as `uint16_t`. Previously, the run length of null map was limited by `batch_size` in the `ParquetReader`, by setting `batch_size = std::min(batch_size, (size_t)USHRT_MAX)`. It works well when the batch size is less than `USHRT_MAX`.
However, [Lazy read](https://github.com/apache/doris/pull/13917) will merge empty batches until reading a non-empty batch or reaching the EOF of a row group, so the `batch_size` may be greater than `USHRT_MAX` in non-predicate columns.
In addition, even if the `batch_size` does not exceed `USHRT_MAX`, the adjacent batches may also make the run  length exceed the `USHRT_MAX` in `ColumnSelectVector::get_next_run`.

## Checklist(Required)

1. Does it affect the original behavior:

    - [x] No
    - [ ] I don't know

title: [enhancement](outfile) add retry for broker pwrite
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

## Problem summary

Problem:
We got following error frequently while `SELECT xxx INTO OUTFILE`:
`ERROR 1064 (HY000): RpcException, msg: Fail to write to broker, broker:TNetworkAddress(hostname=a.b.c.d, port=8111) failed:write() send(): Broken pipe`

Reason:
1. we cache broker thrift client in BE;
2. thrift client check connect `isOpen` only return cached flag, not care the real socket is opened or closed;
3. after we get client from cache, the socket may already closed, then `pwrite` will failed.

How to fix:
Other interfaces such as open and close, will reopen and retry again, but `pwrite` do not retry.
As there are write offset inside `pwrite`, and the broker(server) side also will check the write offset, it is safe to retry `pwrite`.

## Checklist(Required)

1. Does it affect the original behavior:

title: [fix](recycle) refactor the logic of erase meta with same name
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

## Problem summary

in #14482, we implement the feature to keep specific number of meta with same name in catalog recycle bin.
But it will cause meta replay bug.
Because every time we drop db/table/partition, it will try to erase a certain number of meta with same name.
And when replay "drop" edit log, it will do same thing. But the number of meta to erase it based on current config value,
not persist in edit log, so it will cause inconsistency with "drop" and "replay drop".

In this PR, I move the "erase meta with same name" logic to the daemon thread of catalog recycle bin.

title: [fix](outfile) duplicate SUCCESS file request
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

## Problem summary

Problem desc:
While we call `SELECT xxx INTO OUTFILE`,  if we output data file success, we also write an empty `SUCCESS` file.
But now the problem is:
1. if we write data file failed, we also write out an empty `SUCCESS` file;
2. if we write data file success, we write out the empty `SUCCESS` file twice;

Why the problem:
After https://github.com/apache/doris/pull/5489, we refractor _close_file_writer, but not change the caller.
So we will create `SUCCESS` file once inside `close` function, and the other call while we deconstruct `FileResultWriter`.

body:
in the previous the result is:
```
mysql> select array_distinct([1,1,3,3,null, null, null]);
```

title: [fix](storage-policy) use Long instead of Date to persiste cooldowntime in storage policy
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

## Problem summary

Previously, we use "Date" type for `cooldownTime` in StoragePolicy.
But the serialization method of Date type in Gson is different in java8 and java11, which may cause inconsistent meta error.

This PR use Long to save `cooldownTime`.
And notice that in FE, the cooldownTime is saved in milliseconds, and in BE, it is saved in seconds.

title: [feature](multi-catalog) support Jdbc catalog
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

I add `jdbc catalog` for doris multi-catalog feature.
Currently, the `jdbc catalog` only supports `MYSQL` DBMS.

TODO:
1. support for `postgre` DB
2. Support for other databases.


## Problem summary

For `jdbc catalog`, we can create catalog like:
```sql
CREATE CATALOG jdbc4 PROPERTIES (
    "type"="jdbc",
    "jdbc.user"="root",
    "jdbc.password"="123456",
    "jdbc.jdbc_url" = "jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:13396/demo?yearIsDateType=false",
    "jdbc.driver_url" = "file:/mnt/disk2/ftw/tools/jar/mysql-connector-java-5.1.47/mysql-connector-java-5.1.47.jar",
    "jdbc.driver_class" = "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
);
```

Note:
`yearIsDateType` is a param of jdbc:
If yearIsDateType configuration property is set to false, then the returned object type is java.sql.Short. If set to true (the default), then the returned object is of type java.sql.Date with the date set to January 1st, at midnight.
To compat with mysql, we force the use of `yearIsDateType=false` in `FE`. if user sets `yearIsDateType=true`, doris FE will force to change `yearIsDateType=false`.

1. Does it affect the original behavior:

title: [Enhancement](action) Support request the table schema of Non-OLAP table through http action
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #14517 

## Problem summary

This action is used to obtain the table structure information of the specified table.
```
curl -X GET -u xxx:xxx http://fe_host:http_port/api/{db}/{table}/_schema
```

But for Non-OLAP table, this action can not work such as `view`. For example:
```
{"msg":"Error","code":1,"data":"errCode = 7, detailMessage = table type is not OLAP, tableName=xxx, type=VIEW","count":0}
```
This patch is to support request the table schema of Non-OLAP table through this action.

## Checklist(Required)

1. Does it affect the original behavior: 
    - [ ] Yes

title: [fix](new-scan) fix some bugs about new scan node and readers
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

## Problem summary

1.
json reader DCHECK fail because of missing TYPE_STRING

2.
fix bug that if no file is found, the tvf will throw NPE.

3.
The predicate conjuncts can not be pushed down to parquet reader if this is a load task.
Because the predicate should be applied on column of dest table, not on column of source file.

4.
Add a temp property "use_new_load_scan_node" of broker load to make regression test happy.
So that we can use new load scan node for a certain job and avoid setting global FE config.

## Checklist(Required)
